speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: PROLOGUE

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter Chorus

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Now all the youth of England are on fire,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And silken dalliance in the wardrobe lies:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Now thrive the armourers, and honour's thought

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Reigns solely in the breast of every man:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: They sell the pasture now to buy the horse,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Following the mirror of all Christian kings,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: With winged heels, as English Mercuries.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: For now sits Expectation in the air,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And hides a sword from hilts unto the point

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: With crowns imperial, crowns and coronets,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Promised to Harry and his followers.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The French, advised by good intelligence

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Of this most dreadful preparation,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Shake in their fear and with pale policy

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Seek to divert the English purposes.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: O England! model to thy inward greatness,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Like little body with a mighty heart,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: What mightst thou do, that honour would thee do,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Were all thy children kind and natural!

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: But see thy fault! France hath in thee found out

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: A nest of hollow bosoms, which he fills

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: With treacherous crowns; and three corrupted men,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: One, Richard Earl of Cambridge, and the second,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Henry Lord Scroop of Masham, and the third,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Sir Thomas Grey, knight, of Northumberland,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Have, for the gilt of France,--O guilt indeed!

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Confirm'd conspiracy with fearful France;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And by their hands this grace of kings must die,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: If hell and treason hold their promises,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Ere he take ship for France, and in Southampton.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Linger your patience on; and we'll digest

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The abuse of distance; force a play:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The sum is paid; the traitors are agreed;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The king is set from London; and the scene

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Is now transported, gentles, to Southampton;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: There is the playhouse now, there must you sit:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And thence to France shall we convey you safe,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And bring you back, charming the narrow seas

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: To give you gentle pass; for, if we may,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: We'll not offend one stomach with our play.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: But, till the king come forth, and not till then,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Unto Southampton do we shift our scene.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Exit
